meanings.definition: the quality of being open and honest in expression
meanings.sent1: Her candour in admitting her mistake impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate your candour in telling me the truth.
meanings.sent3: His candour about his fear of spiders made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: The candour of the artist's brushstrokes revealed his true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The politician's candour on stage left a lasting impact on the audience.

meanings.definition: the state or quality of being sincere and straightforward
meanings.sent1: The candour of her apology touched my heart.
meanings.sent2: His candour in handling difficult situations is admirable.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's candour about his love life brought smiles to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The candour of the mountain's peak took my breath away.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's candour in explaining complex topics made learning easier for the students.
